meanings.definition: The act of breaking or splitting something open.
meanings.sent1: The crackings of the nutshell were loud.
meanings.sent2: I heard the crackings of the ice under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The crackings of the pinata brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent4: The crackings of the old door echoed through the house.
meanings.sent5: The crackings of the thunder made the ground shake.

meanings.definition: The sound of something breaking or snapping.
meanings.sent1: The tree branch's crackings scared the birds away.
meanings.sent2: The crackings of the glass were sharp and sudden.
meanings.sent3: The crackings of the popcorn in the microwave made me hungry.
meanings.sent4: The crackings of the firewood signaled the start of the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The crackings of the ice warned of danger ahead.

meanings.definition: The process of extracting oil from petroleum by heating it to high temperatures.
meanings.sent1: The crackings in the refinery produced valuable fuels.
meanings.sent2: The crackings in the distillation tower separated the components.
meanings.sent3: The crackings in the lab were crucial for oil production.
meanings.sent4: The crackings in the pipeline improved the efficiency of extraction.
meanings.sent5: The crackings in the process released useful byproducts.

meanings.definition: Leftover pieces of food or snacks.
meanings.sent1: The crackings from the party were saved for later.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed the crackings of the cookies after dinner.
meanings.sent3: The crackings of the chips were a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: The crackings of the bread were perfect for feeding the birds.
meanings.sent5: The crackings of the fruit made a colorful snack.
